findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments, leading to potential issues with gas efficiency, complexity, readability, security, and maintainability.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to decrease gas consumption and ensure that the value cannot be changed.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The contract does not adhere to Solidity naming conventions, making it harder to understand and maintain.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is declared in the contract, increasing clutter and deployment costs.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: The contract lacks events arithmetic, making it unclear if all required events are included.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: The order of operations may cause loss of precision due to division before multiplication.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using uninitialized local variables can lead to unpredictable behavior and errors.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The pragma solidity version is not locked, which may cause compatibility issues.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: The contract does not check if the transfer method is successful, potentially leading to unexpected behavior.
